alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 3:26PM EST until January 18 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 30 to 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, several inches of heavy snow possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern New Hampshire and west central and western Maine. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Plan on slippery road conditions on Monday.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford
